sentences.en: A pat answer is not going to satisfy an inquisitive audience.
sentences.cn: 陈腔烂调的答案不能满足好奇的听众.
巴罗天生就爱打听别人隐私。

sentences.en: Bears are very inquisitive and must be kept mentally stimulated.
sentences.cn: 熊非常好奇，必须不断地给予其智力上的刺激。

sentences.en: Don't be so inquisitive. It's none of your business!
sentences.cn: 别这么追根问底的。这与你无关！

sentences.en: He surveyed me with an inquisitive look.
sentences.cn: 他以好奇的眼光(从头到脚)仔细地打量我.

sentences.en: I’d have asked more questions, but I didn’t want to seem inquisitive.
sentences.cn: 我本想问更多的问题，但我不想看上去那么爱打听。

sentences.en: Jim frowned from time to time when he caught the inquisitive glance of some strangers.
sentences.cn: 杰姆在瞥见某些陌生人好奇的眼光时一再皱起眉头.
灵长目动物是机灵 、 好奇的动物.

sentences.en: She is very inquisitive, and asks for too many personal questions.
sentences.cn: 她非常爱打听别人的事, 问了许多牵涉到个人私事的问题.

sentences.en: She was a bit inquisitive, as girls are.
sentences.cn: 她像所有女孩一样,有点好奇.

sentences.en: She was very inquisitive about other people's affairs.
sentences.cn: 她太爱打听别人的私事.

sentences.en: The child has an inquisitive mind.
Then, seeing her still inquisitive, he added: " I think I can get on over there. "
sentences.cn: 然后, 见她还想问的样子, 便补充说: “ 我想我可以上那里找到事做. ”

sentences.en: They show an inquisitive mind casting about in a variety of directions.
sentences.cn: 他们显示了一颗追根问底的心,在向四方探索.

trans.tran_cn: 好问的，好奇的，爱打听的
trans.tran_en: asking too many questions and trying to find out too many details about something or someone
